post.file: #!/bin/bash # # set the correct number of CPUs for the frontend on each boot # /opt/rocks/bin/rocks set host cpus localhost \ `grep 'processor' /proc/cpuinfo | wc -l`

kickstart.post:
AIRBOSS=`/bin/cat /proc/cmdline | /bin/awk \ 'BEGIN {RS="[[:space:]]"; FS="="} /airboss/{print $2}'`
if [ "$AIRBOSS" != "" ] then /opt/rocks/bin/rocks add host attr localhost airboss $AIRBOSS fi

/opt/rocks/bin/rocks set host attr localhost roll_install_on_the_fly true \ shadow=yes
rm -f /etc/rc.d/rocksconfig.d/post-02-on-the-fly

post.file:
#!/bin/bash # # create cluster-wide rsa and dsa keys # Put them in the rocks secure attribute database # MOUNTPOINT=/mnt/priv if [ ! -d $MOUNTPOINT ]; then mkdir $MOUNTPOINT; fi mount -t ramfs -o size=1m ramfs $MOUNTPOINT chmod 700 $MOUNTPOINT
RSAKEY=ssh_host_rsa_key DSAKEY=ssh_host_dsa_key for file in ${MOUNTPOINT}/${RSAKEY}* ${MOUNTPOINT}/${DSAKEY}*; do if [ -f $file ]; then /bin/rm -f $file fi done
# generate the keyfiles /usr/bin/ssh-keygen -q -t rsa -N '' -f ${MOUNTPOINT}/$RSAKEY /usr/bin/ssh-keygen -q -t dsa -N '' -f ${MOUNTPOINT}/$DSAKEY for file in ${RSAKEY} ${DSAKEY}; do chmod 0400 ${MOUNTPOINT}/$file done
# The following will fail if the key is already there, that's OK!
/opt/rocks/bin/rocks add sec_attr $RSAKEY value=${MOUNTPOINT}/${RSAKEY} crypted=true /opt/rocks/bin/rocks add sec_attr $DSAKEY value=${MOUNTPOINT}/${DSAKEY} crypted=true
/bin/umount $MOUNTPOINT
# Run this script only once /bin/rm -f /etc/rc.d/rocksconfig.d/post-50-cluster-ssh-keys
